sections.title: Insurance Contracts
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 17.

items.question: Has the entity presented unadjusted comparative information and disclosures for earlier periods under IFRS 17?
items.original_question: If an entity presents unadjusted comparative information and disclosures for any earlier periods, does it a. Clearly identify the information that has not been adjusted b. Disclose that it has been prepared on a different basis c. Explain that basis

decision_tree.question: Has the entity presented unadjusted comparative information and disclosures for earlier periods under IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, specifically the comparative year column in primary financial statements and related disclosures in the notes. Look for any indication that earlier period information has not been adjusted to comply with IFRS 17. For example, check if changes in accounting policies or transition notes outline unadjusted comparative amounts.

yes_case.question: Does the entity clearly identify the information that has not been adjusted for earlier periods?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that unadjusted comparative information is explicitly labeled in the primary financial statements or disclosed in the notes. Common pitfalls include failing to distinguish adjusted from unadjusted amounts or inadequate labeling of comparative information.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose that the unadjusted comparative information has been prepared on a different basis?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for disclosures explicitly stating that the unadjusted comparative information is prepared under a different basis (e.g., previous accounting standards). The entity should avoid leaving this unstated.

yes_case.question: Does the entity explain the basis on which the unadjusted comparative information was prepared?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm the explanation of the basis in the financial statement notes. This includes specifying the accounting standards or policies applied in earlier periods. Beware of vague disclosures that do not sufficiently describe the prior basis.

items.question: Has the entity adopted IFRS 17 for its annual reporting period?
items.original_question: An entity need not disclose previously unpublished information about claims development that occurred earlier than five years before the end of the annual reporting period in which it first applies IFRS 17. However, if an entity does not disclose that information, does it disclose that fact

decision_tree.question: Has the entity adopted IFRS 17 for its annual reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's financial statements and accounting policies to confirm whether IFRS 17 is applied. Review the 'Significant Accounting Policies' section and verify references to IFRS 17 implementation.

yes_case.question: Did the entity choose not to disclose previously unpublished information about claims development that occurred earlier than five years before the end of the annual reporting period in which IFRS 17 was first applied?
yes_case.guidance: Analyze disclosure notes related to insurance contracts and claims development information. Specifically, check if the entity has omitted details from periods earlier than five years prior to IFRS 17 adoption.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the fact that it has not provided the previously unpublished claims development information?
yes_case.guidance: Carefully examine the financial statement disclosures. Look for explicit mention of the decision not to provide pre-adoption claims development information. This should be clearly stated in the notes accompanying the financial statements.

items.question: Has the entity applied paragraphs C28B-C28D of IFRS 17?
items.original_question: If an entity applies paragraphs C28B-C28D, does it disclose qualitative information that enables users of financial statements to understand: a. The extent to which the classification overlay has been applied (for example, whether it has been applied to all financial assets derecognised in the comparative period) b. Whether and to what extent the impairment requirements in Section 5.5 of IFRS 9 have been applied (see paragraph C28C)

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied paragraphs C28B-C28D of IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial reporting policies and notes to the financial statements. Paragraphs C28B-C28D discuss the classification overlay approach for financial assets derecognised in comparative periods during IFRS 17 adoption. Check if the entity has explicitly stated the application of these paragraphs in its policies or disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose qualitative information to enable users of financial statements to understand the extent of the classification overlay applied?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements, specifically disclosures related to the classification overlay approach. Confirm if the entity discloses information such as whether the classification overlay has been applied to all financial assets derecognised in the comparative period.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose whether and to what extent impairment requirements in Section 5.5 of IFRS 9 have been applied, as per paragraph C28C?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures regarding impairment requirements under IFRS 9. Confirm that the entity provides sufficient information to communicate whether, and to what extent, these requirements were applied to the financial assets in the comparative period.

items.question: Does the entity apply IFRS 17.C29 in its financial statements?
items.original_question: When an entity applies IFRS 17.C29 (see above), does it disclose in that annual reporting period for those financial assets by class: a. If paragraph C29(a) applies — its basis for determining eligible financial assets b. If any of paragraphs C29(a)–C29(e) apply: ► The measurement category and carrying amount of the affected financial assets determined immediately before the date of initial application of IFRS 17 ► The new measurement category and carrying amount of the affected financial assets determined after applying paragraph C29 c. If paragraph C29(b) applies — the carrying amount of financial assets in the statement of financial position that were previously designated as measured at fair value through profit or loss applying IFRS 9.4.1.5 that are no longer so designated

decision_tree.question: Does the entity apply IFRS 17.C29 in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's accounting policies and disclosures in the annual financial statements. Specifically, check if the entity applies IFRS 17.C29 for financial assets when transitioning to IFRS 17. This section addresses modifications to the measurement categories and carrying amounts of financial assets during initial application of IFRS 17.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the basis for determining eligible financial assets if IFRS 17.C29(a) applies?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures regarding financial assets in the entity's annual financial statements. Paragraph C29(a) requires disclosure of the basis for determining eligible financial assets during transition. Common pitfalls include vague or incomplete disclosure of the criteria used.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the measurement category and carrying amount of affected financial assets before and after the application of IFRS 17.C29(a)–C29(e)?
yes_case.guidance: Verify that the disclosures include the measurement category (e.g., amortized cost, fair value through profit or loss) and the carrying amounts immediately before and after initial application of IFRS 17.C29(a)–C29(e). Ensure these are presented by financial asset class and are consistent with IFRS 17.C32 requirements.

yes_case.question: If IFRS 17.C29(b) applies, is the carrying amount disclosed for financial assets that were previously designated as measured at FVTPL (applying IFRS 9.4.1.5) but are no longer designated as such?
yes_case.guidance: Check that the financial statement notes disclose the carrying amounts of financial assets previously measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL) under IFRS 9.4.1.5 but that, under IFRS 17.C29(b), are no longer designated as such. Review the fair value adjustments in IFRS 17 transition disclosures.

items.question: Did the entity apply IFRS 17 paragraph C29 during the annual reporting period?
items.original_question: When an entity applies IFRS 17.C29, does it disclose in that annual reporting period, qualitative information that would enable users of financial statements to understand: a. How it applied paragraph C29 to financial assets the classification of which has changed on initially applying IFRS 17 b. The reasons for any designation or de-designation of financial assets as measured at fair value through profit or loss when applying IFRS 9.4.1.5 c. Why the entity came to any different conclusions in the new assessment applying IFRS 9.4.1.2(a) or IFRS 9.4.1.2A(a)

decision_tree.question: Did the entity apply IFRS 17 paragraph C29 during the annual reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the accounting policies and notes in the annual financial report to confirm if the entity applied IFRS 17.C29, which concerns the reclassification of financial assets upon transitioning to IFRS 17. Look carefully for any disclosures regarding reclassifications under IFRS 17.

yes_case.question: Did the entity reclassify financial assets due to the initial application of IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity’s disclosures related to financial assets in the transition to IFRS 17. Specifically, check if there is any mention of reclassified financial assets as a result of applying IFRS 17. Look at the notes accompanying Statement of Financial Position and any relevant transition disclosures.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose qualitative information enabling users to understand the application of IFRS 17.C29 to financial assets reclassified?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statement notes for qualitative disclosures. Ensure the entity has provided sufficient explanations regarding: a) how it applied IFRS 17.C29, b) reasons for designation/dedication of financial assets at fair value through profit or loss under IFRS 9.4.1.5, and c) discussions of new assessments under IFRS 9.4.1.2(a) or IFRS 9.4.1.2A(a). Lack of these details can lead to non-compliance.

items.question: Did the entity transition to IFRS 17 in the reporting period under review?
items.original_question: In the reporting period that includes the date of initial application of these amendments, does the entity disclose the following information as at the transition date for each class of financial assets and financial liabilities that was affected by the transition to IFRS 17: d. The reasons for any designation or de-designation of financial liabilities as measured at fair value through profit or loss

decision_tree.question: Did the entity transition to IFRS 17 in the reporting period under review?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial reporting standards applied in the current reporting period, as disclosed in the financial statements. Check the section discussing changes in accounting policies or standards. Look for references to IFRS 17 amendments and confirm whether they have been applied for the first time during this period.

yes_case.question: Were any financial assets or financial liabilities affected by the transition to IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosures provided in the financial statements, particularly those concerning financial instruments. Look for evidence of reclassification, designation, or de-designation of financial assets or liabilities as measured at fair value through profit or loss (FVTPL) during the transition to IFRS 17.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reasons for any designation or de-designation of financial liabilities as measured at fair value through profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements that detail the entity's transition to IFRS 17. Ensure the reasons for changes in designation or de-designation of financial liabilities measured at FVTPL are clearly explained, as required by IFRS 9.7.2.42.

items.question: Did the entity have insurance contracts that existed at the transition date under IFRS 17?
items.original_question: To enable users of financial statements to identify the effect of groups of insurance contracts measured at the transition date applying either the modified retrospective approach (see IFRS 17.C6–C19A) or the fair value approach (see IFRS 17.C20–C24B) on the contractual service margin and insurance revenue in subsequent periods, does the entity disclose the reconciliation of the contractual service margin applying IFRS 17.101(c), and the amount of insurance revenue applying IFRS 17.103(a), separately for: a. Insurance contracts that existed at the transition date to which the entity has applied the modified retrospective approach b. Insurance contracts that existed at the transition date to which the entity has applied the fair value approach c. All other insurance contracts

decision_tree.question: Did the entity have insurance contracts that existed at the transition date under IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's transitional documentation and financial statements to confirm whether the entity had any insurance contracts in force as of the transition date as defined in IFRS 17. Check implementation evidence, including contracts and actuarial reports targeting the transition date. Verify this information against IFRS 17.C1.

yes_case.question: Did the entity apply either the modified retrospective approach (IFRS 17.C6–C19A) or the fair value approach (IFRS 17.C20–C24B) to measure groups of insurance contracts at the transition date?
yes_case.guidance: Assess the methodology applied by the entity at the transition date by reviewing transition disclosures in the financial statements. Ensure that the entity's approach aligns with the criteria defined in IFRS 17.C6–C19A for the modified retrospective approach or IFRS 17.C20–C24B for the fair value approach.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the reconciliation of the contractual service margin applying IFRS 17.101(c) and the amount of insurance revenue applying IFRS 17.103(a) separately for each category of insurance contracts?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosure notes in the financial statements and the reconciliation tables provided. Verify whether the entity has separated the information for: (a) insurance contracts measured using the modified retrospective approach, (b) those using the fair value approach, and (c) all other insurance contracts. Compare the disclosures to the requirements outlined in IFRS 17.101(c) and IFRS 17.103(a).

items.question: Does the entity apply IFRS 17 and disclose information under IFRS 17.114(a) or IFRS 17.114(b)?
items.original_question: For all periods in which disclosures are made applying IFRS 17.114(a) or 114(b), to enable users of financial statements to understand the nature and significance of the methods used and judgements applied in determining the transition amounts, does the entity explain how it determined the measurement of insurance contracts at the transition date

decision_tree.question: Does the entity apply IFRS 17 and disclose information under IFRS 17.114(a) or IFRS 17.114(b)?
decision_tree.guidance: Check whether the entity applies IFRS 17 for their insurance contracts. Review the notes to the financial statements and confirm if disclosures required under IFRS 17.114(a) or IFRS 17.114(b) are included. IFRS 17.114(a) requires disclosure of qualitative and quantitative information about the methods and judgements, whereas IFRS 17.114(b) focuses on the nature and significance of methods used at transition. Ensure that these disclosures are explicitly referenced.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed sufficient information about the measurement of insurance contracts at the transition date to enable users of financial statements to understand the nature and significance of the methods used and judgements applied?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures accompanying the financial statements related to the transition amounts under IFRS 17. Confirm that the disclosures include explanations about the determination of measurement at transition date, including methods used and any significant judgements applied. Pay close attention to consistency with IFRS 17.115 and ensure that the disclosures are clear and comprehensive.

items.question: Has the entity chosen to disaggregate insurance finance income or expenses between profit or loss and other comprehensive income?
items.original_question: An entity that chooses to disaggregate insurance finance income or expenses between profit or loss and other comprehensive income applies IFRS 17.C18(b), C19(b), C24(b) and C24(c) to determine the cumulative difference between the insurance finance income or expenses that would have been recognised in profit or loss and the total insurance finance income or expenses at the transition date for the groups of insurance contracts to which the disaggregation applies. For all periods in which the amounts determined, when applying these paragraphs, exist, does the entity disclose a reconciliation from the opening to the closing balance of the cumulative amounts included in other comprehensive income for financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income related to the groups of insurance contracts

decision_tree.question: Has the entity chosen to disaggregate insurance finance income or expenses between profit or loss and other comprehensive income?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accounting policy disclosures regarding insurance finance income or expenses. Check if the entity explicitly states its choice to disaggregate these amounts and apply IFRS 17.C18(b), C19(b), C24(b), and C24(c) as applicable.

yes_case.question: At the transition date, did the entity determine the cumulative difference between the insurance finance income or expenses that would have been recognised in profit or loss and the total insurance finance income or expenses as per IFRS 17.C18(b), C19(b), C24(b), and C24(c)?
yes_case.guidance: Review transition disclosures and calculations in accordance with IFRS 17 guidelines. Ensure the entity has appropriately applied paragraphs C18(b), C19(b), C24(b), and C24(c) to calculate the cumulative difference for relevant groups of insurance contracts.

yes_case.question: During the reporting period, do amounts determined under IFRS 17.C18(b), C19(b), C24(b), and C24(c) exist for the groups of insurance contracts?
yes_case.guidance: Check if there are amounts determined under the specified IFRS 17 paragraphs during the reporting period for the groups of insurance contracts. These amounts would typically be disclosed in the reconciliation.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose a reconciliation from the opening to the closing balance of the cumulative amounts included in other comprehensive income for financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, related to the groups of insurance contracts?
yes_case.guidance: Verify in the notes to the financial statements whether the entity provides a reconciliation showing the opening and closing balances of the cumulative amounts in OCI for financial assets measured at FVOCI. Compare the disclosure to the requirements in IFRS 17.116.

items.question: Does the entity have insurance contracts issued or reinsurance contracts held?
items.original_question: Does the entity present separately in the statement of financial position the carrying amount of portfolios of: a. Insurance contracts issued that are assets b. Insurance contracts issued that are liabilities c. Reinsurance contracts held that are assets d. Reinsurance contracts held that are liabilities

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have insurance contracts issued or reinsurance contracts held?
decision_tree.guidance: Check whether the entity is engaged in insurance or reinsurance activities. Review the business model and the financial statements, in particular the notes on significant accounting policies, Statement of Financial Position, and disclosures relating to IFRS 17.

yes_case.question: Are the carrying amounts of portfolios for the following contracts presented separately in the Statement of Financial Position: a. Insurance contracts issued that are assets, b. Insurance contracts issued that are liabilities, c. Reinsurance contracts held that are assets, d. Reinsurance contracts held that are liabilities?
yes_case.guidance: Review the Statement of Financial Position and relevant notes. Each portfolio type must be clearly separated as per IFRS 17.78 and IFRS 17.79. Ensure there is no aggregation of assets and liabilities for these portfolios. Confirm the presentation is distinct and complies with the standard's requirements.

items.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts covered by IFRS 17?
items.original_question: Applying IFRS 17.41-42, does the entity disaggregate the amounts recognised in the statement(s) of profit or loss and other comprehensive income (hereafter referred to as the statement(s) of financial performance in this section) into: a. An insurance service result (see IFRS 17.83–86), comprising insurance revenue and insurance service expenses And b. Insurance finance income or expenses (see IFRS 17.87–92)

decision_tree.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts covered by IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's business model and financial statements to confirm if it issues insurance contracts as defined under IFRS 17. An insurance contract contains significant insurance risk or includes service components as discussed in IFRS 17 Appendix A. Common pitfalls include misclassifying contracts or failing to identify contracts with significant insurance risk.

yes_case.question: Does the entity recognise amounts related to insurance contracts in the statement(s) of financial performance (profit or loss and other comprehensive income)?
yes_case.guidance: Review the most recent statement(s) of financial performance. Identify any amounts related to insurance contracts, such as insurance revenue, insurance service expenses, and insurance finance income or expenses. Ensure you check for omission of relevant items or incorrect classification.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disaggregate recognised amounts into: a. Insurance service result (comprising insurance revenue and insurance service expenses, as per IFRS 17.83-86) and b. Insurance finance income or expenses (as per IFRS 17.87-92)?
yes_case.guidance: Check whether the statement(s) of financial performance clearly separate the amounts into the insurance service result and insurance finance income or expenses. Refer to paragraph 83-92 of IFRS 17 for guidance on how these amounts should be disaggregated and presented. Verify accurate classification and compliance with IFRS 17.41-42.

items.question: Does the entity hold reinsurance contracts as part of its insurance operations?
items.original_question: Does the entity present income or expenses from reinsurance contracts held separately from the expenses or income from insurance contracts issued

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold reinsurance contracts as part of its insurance operations?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's insurance contract portfolio and supporting documentation such as contracts and notes to financial statements. Check for the existence of reinsurance contracts held (i.e., where the entity cedes risks to other insurers). Avoid assumptions; confirm existence explicitly.

yes_case.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts to policyholders in addition to holding reinsurance contracts?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the entity's list of liabilities and revenue streams in the financial statements. Look for issued insurance contracts or references to revenue from premiums received.

yes_case.question: Does the entity separately present income or expenses from reinsurance contracts held from expenses or income of insurance contracts issued in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the Statement of Comprehensive Income and accompanying notes. Confirm that income and expenses from reinsurance contracts held are tabulated distinctly from income/expenses relating to insurance contracts issued, per IFRS 17.82. Look for proper headings, grouping, and detailed breakdowns.

items.question: Does the entity issue groups of insurance contracts?
items.original_question: Does the entity present in profit or loss insurance revenue arising from the groups of insurance contracts issued

decision_tree.question: Does the entity issue groups of insurance contracts?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and associated disclosures for evidence of groups of insurance contracts issued. Refer to the notes detailing contract liabilities in accordance with IFRS 17. Check whether the entity operates in the insurance industry. If there are no groups of insurance contracts issued, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Are the insurance contracts recognized as part of the group's insurance revenue in profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Check the Statement of Profit or Loss to verify if insurance revenue is reported. Refer to IFRS 17.83 to ensure that revenue arising from the groups of insurance contracts issued is appropriately presented under ‘insurance revenue’. Confirm there is no misclassification or omission.

yes_case.question: Is the presentation of insurance revenue consistent with IFRS 17 requirements, showing revenue net of any investment components and separate from insurance finance income or expenses?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the profit or loss statement and related disclosures to confirm compliance with IFRS 17.83. Ensure that investment components are excluded from insurance revenue and verify whether insurance revenue is distinct from finance income or expenses. Avoid common errors such as combining these elements under a single revenue line.

items.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts that fall within the scope of IFRS 17?
items.original_question: Does the entity present in profit or loss insurance service expenses arising from a group of insurance contracts issued, comprising incurred claims (excluding repayments of investment components), other incurred insurance service expenses and other amounts as described in IFRS 17.103(b)

decision_tree.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts that fall within the scope of IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's portfolio of contracts and assess whether it includes insurance contracts as defined in IFRS 17 Appendix A. An insurance contract transfers significant insurance risk and meets the criteria outlined in the standard. Common pitfalls include misclassification of contracts or overlooking long-duration contracts.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present insurance service expenses from a group of insurance contracts in profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Review the Statement of Profit or Loss and accompanying disclosures. Verify that insurance service expenses are segregated and reported as a distinct line item. Check the reporting format against IFRS 17.84.

yes_case.question: Do the insurance service expenses presented comprise incurred claims (excluding repayments of investment components), other incurred insurance service expenses, and other amounts as described in IFRS 17.103(b)?
yes_case.guidance: Cross-reference the presented insurance service expenses in profit or loss with the requirements of IFRS 17.103(b). Confirm that incurred claims exclude repayments of investment components, and the amounts are accurately categorized and disclosed. Pay attention to the distinction between insurance service expenses and investment components. Ensure detailed review of line items to avoid misclassification.

items.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts covered by IFRS 17?
items.original_question: Insurance revenue and insurance service expenses presented in profit or loss must exclude any investment components. Does the entity avoid presenting premium information in profit or loss if that information is inconsistent with IFRS 17.83

decision_tree.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts covered by IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's insurance contracts and financial statements. Confirm whether the contracts meet the definition of insurance contracts as per IFRS 17.3, which includes contracts where an entity accepts significant insurance risk. If no contracts meet this definition, this checklist item is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present insurance revenue and insurance service expenses in profit or loss?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the profit or loss statement and related disclosures. Verify if insurance revenue and insurance service expenses are distinctly presented, as required by IFRS 17.85.

yes_case.question: Do the presented insurance revenue and insurance service expenses exclude investment components?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm whether the entity excludes investment components from insurance revenue and service expenses. Refer to IFRS 17.85, ensuring that amounts related solely to the transfer of insurance risk are presented. Check underlying calculations and disclosures for transparency.

yes_case.question: Does the entity avoid presenting premium information in profit or loss that is inconsistent with IFRS 17.83?
yes_case.guidance: Review the premium information presented in profit or loss. Ensure that the entity avoids presenting gross premium amounts or premium information inconsistent with IFRS 17.83. Premiums should reflect the expected pattern of transfer of services under the contract and should not distort the financial position.

items.question: Does the entity hold reinsurance contracts as defined under IFRS 17?
items.original_question: If an entity presents separately the amounts recovered from the reinsurer and an allocation of the premiums paid, does it: a. Treat reinsurance cash flows that are contingent on claims on the underlying contracts as part of the claims that are expected to be reimbursed under the reinsurance contract held b. Treat amounts from the reinsurer that it expects to receive that are not contingent on claims of the underlying contracts (for example, some types of ceding commissions) as a reduction in the premiums to be paid to the reinsurer c. Treat amounts recognised relating to the recovery of losses applying IFRS 17.66(c)(i)‒(ii) and 66A‒66B as amounts recovered from the reinsurer d. Avoid presenting the allocation of premiums paid as a reduction in revenue

decision_tree.question: Does the entity hold reinsurance contracts as defined under IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Verify the existence of reinsurance contracts held by the entity as outlined in IFRS 17. Refer to the contract agreements and confirm that they meet the definition in IFRS 17.2(a) as contracts whereby one entity (reinsurer) compensates another entity (policyholder) for financial loss related to events covered by insurance contracts issued by the policyholder.

yes_case.question: Does the entity present separately the amounts recovered from the reinsurer and an allocation of premiums paid?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements, specifically the Statement of Comprehensive Income or relevant disclosures, to ensure the entity presents separately amounts recovered from the reinsurer and allocations of premiums paid as required under IFRS 17. Verify if these components are clearly stated.

yes_case.question: Does the entity treat reinsurance cash flows contingent on claims on underlying contracts as part of the claims expected to be reimbursed under the reinsurance contract held?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to the breakdown of reinsurance cash flows in the financial records and disclosures. Test whether reinsurance cash flows contingent on claims are treated as part of the claims reimbursed under the reinsurance contract held (per IFRS 17.86(a)).

yes_case.question: Does the entity treat amounts from the reinsurer expected to be received that are not contingent on claims (e.g., ceding commissions) as a reduction in premiums paid to the reinsurer?
yes_case.guidance: Check if amounts such as ceding commissions, when not contingent on claims of the underlying contracts, are properly treated as a reduction in premiums reported to the reinsurer (per IFRS 17.86(b)).

yes_case.question: Are amounts recognized relating to the recovery of losses (per IFRS 17.66(c)(i)-(ii), 66A, and 66B) correctly treated as amounts recovered from the reinsurer?
yes_case.guidance: Ensure that loss recoveries under the specified IFRS 17 paragraphs are presented appropriately as amounts recovered from the reinsurer. Validate this by examining how loss recoveries are allocated in financial disclosures.

yes_case.question: Does the entity avoid presenting the allocation of premiums paid as a reduction in revenue?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm from the presentation of revenue in the financial statements that the allocation of premiums paid is not incorrectly presented as a reduction in revenue (per IFRS 17.86(d)).

items.question: Does the entity have contracts that fall within the scope of IFRS 17?
items.original_question: To achieve the disclosure objective described in IFRS 17.93, does the entity disclose qualitative and quantitative information about: a. The amounts recognised in its financial statements for contracts within the scope of IFRS 17 (see IFRS 17.97– 116) b. The significant judgements, and changes in those judgements, made when applying IFRS 17 (see IFRS 17.117–120) c. The nature and extent of the risks from contracts within the scope of IFRS 17 (see IFRS 17.121–132)

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have contracts that fall within the scope of IFRS 17?
decision_tree.guidance: Review contractual agreements and assess whether they are insurance contracts or investment contracts with discretionary participation features, as defined by IFRS 17. Refer to IFRS 17.3–8 for definitions and scope exclusions. Check if there are any contracts clearly outside the scope, such as warranties issued directly by manufacturers.

yes_case.question: Are amounts related to the contracts within the scope of IFRS 17 recognized in the entity's financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Inspect the entity's financial statements for amounts attributable to insurance or investment contracts covered by IFRS 17. Verify whether recognition criteria in IFRS 17.32–33 were met, such as whether insurance liabilities or assets are reported.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose qualitative and quantitative information about the amounts recognized in its financial statements for contracts within the scope of IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the disclosure notes in the financial statements. Information should encompass explanations about the amounts recognized (IFRS 17.97–116) and comply with requirements such as reconciliations, measurement methods, and other disclosures mandated in this section.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information about the significant judgements made, and changes in those judgements, when applying IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate whether the entity provides disclosures about significant judgements, including those related to assumptions, estimates, and transitions (IFRS 17.117–120). This includes metrics like risk adjustment and discount rates, as well as changes in previous judgements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information about the nature and extent of risks from contracts within the scope of IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Confirm that disclosures address risks such as insurance and market risks as required by IFRS 17.121–132. Review sections discussing sensitivity analyses, risk concentrations, and mitigation activities.

items.question: Has the entity disclosed information under IFRS 17.97–132 in its financial statements?
items.original_question: An entity must consider the level of detail necessary to satisfy the disclosure objective and how much emphasis to place on each of the various requirements. If the disclosures provided, applying IFRS 17.97–132, are not enough to meet the objective in IFRS 17.93, does an entity disclose additional information necessary to meet that objective

decision_tree.question: Has the entity disclosed information under IFRS 17.97–132 in its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Examine the financial statements, particularly the notes. Look for disclosures specifically outlined in IFRS 17.97–132, such as the nature and amount of insurance contract liabilities, the impact of transfers of reinsurance contracts held, and reconciliations of relevant balances. Ensure that these disclosures exist and are properly detailed.

yes_case.question: Do the disclosures under IFRS 17.97–132 meet the disclosure objective set out in IFRS 17.93?
yes_case.guidance: Review the objective outlined in IFRS 17.93, which requires information to provide users with a basis to assess the effect of insurance contracts on the entity’s financial position, financial performance, and cash flows. Evaluate if the disclosures are sufficiently detailed, clear, and emphasize the relevant requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity considered providing additional information if necessary to fully meet the disclosure objective in IFRS 17.93?
yes_case.guidance: Verify whether the entity evaluated the adequacy of its disclosures and considered adding supplemental information (e.g., additional tables, qualitative explanations, or segmental details) to fully meet IFRS 17.93 requirements.

no_case.question: Is the non-disclosure of information under IFRS 17.97–132 due to the entity's judgment that such disclosure is immaterial?

Verify the definition against the documentation provided by the entity and identify such contracts.

yes_case.question: Has the entity chosen not to adjust the contractual service margin for some changes in fulfilment cash flows, as permitted by IFRS 17.B115?

Refer to IFRS 17.B115 for the requirements and policy options.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the effect of this choice (not adjusting the contractual service margin for some changes in fulfilment cash flows) on the adjustment to the contractual service margin in the current period?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements or disclosure notes for compliance with IFRS 17.112. Look specifically for disclosures that explain how this choice impacts the adjustments to the contractual service margin for the current reporting period. Ensure transparency and sufficient information for users of financial statements.

decision_tree.question: Does the entity issue insurance contracts with direct participation features?

Refer to IFRS 17.113 and IFRS 17 Appendix B (specifically IFRS 17.B101–B113) to confirm their classification.

yes_case.question: Has the entity changed the basis of disaggregation of insurance finance income or expenses between profit or loss and other comprehensive income during the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity’s financial statements and disclosures for evidence of a change in approach, as described in IFRS 17.B135. Look for terms like 'change in disaggregation' in discussions of insurance finance income or expenses across profit and loss and OCI.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose, in the period when the change occurred, the reason for the change in basis of disaggregation, as required by IFRS 17.B135?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the entity explains why it was required to change this basis of disaggregation. Look for detailed disclosures in the financial statements explaining the rationale. Ensure it complies with IFRS 17.B135.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount of any adjustment for each financial statement line item affected by the change?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements for a clear breakdown of adjustments affecting individual line items, such as insurance finance income or expenses. Cross-reference these disclosures against IFRS 17.B135 requirements.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of the group of insurance contracts to which the change applied at the date of the change?
yes_case.guidance: Locate the carrying amounts for the affected group of insurance contracts at the date of change within the disclosures. Ensure the information is presented in accordance with IFRS 17.B135.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed changes in the significant judgements made in applying IFRS 17?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes for disclosures specifically addressing any updates or revisions to previously made judgements under IFRS 17. Ensure the changes are clearly explained and the impact on the financial statements is transparent.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the technique used and the corresponding confidence level for results of that technique?

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed: a. That the period-end exposure is not representative during the period, b. The reason why it’s not representative, and c. Further information that is representative?

yes_case.question: For each type of risk, does the entity disclose its objectives, policies, and processes for managing the risks, as well as the methods used to measure the risks, as required by IFRS 17.124(b)?

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed any changes in the exposures, objectives, or risk management processes compared to the prior period, as required by IFRS 17.124(c)?
yes_case.guidance: Compare the current period disclosures to those of the prior period. Ensure that any changes (e.g., new reinsurance arrangements, adjustments to measurement methods) are clearly explained and provide sufficient detail to understand their impact.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the required quantitative information about risk exposure at the end of the reporting period?

yes_case.question: Does the entity provide all disclosures required by IFRS 17.127–132 to the extent they are not duplicated by IFRS 17.125(a)?
